content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    # Regular expression to match julia code blocks with three backticks
    pattern = r"```julia([^\n]+?)```"m
    
    # Match all occurrences of the pattern and store them in an Array
    matches = eachmatch(pattern, md)
    
    # Initialize a String to hold the extracted code blocks
    code_blocks = ""
    
    # Iterate over matches
    for match in matches
        # Get the content inside the code fence
        content = match[1]
        
        # Remove the leading and trailing backticks from the content
        stripped_content = strip(content, '<'*'>')
        
        # Append the stripped content to the String
        code_blocks *= stripped_content * "\n"
    end
    
    # Return the string with all code blocks joined together
    return code_blocks
end
```
